result.execSummary:
The defendant Demarco Lee As-Saffat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments, to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release of extended supervision.
Court ordered restitution set at $0.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Consecutive to: Count 2 and concurrent with Counts 3 and 4, with credit for 465 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Vocational/educational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No drugs.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with victim.

Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Mental health assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1 and concurrent with Counts 3 and 4, with credit for 0 days time served.
Concurrent with: Counts 1, 2 and 4, with credit for 465 days time served.
Concurrent with: Counts 1, 2 and 3, with credit for 465 days time served.

Per order dated April 30, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP2084, IT IS ORDERED that the motion itself shall be deemed to be timely but nonconforming petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat Rules 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed witht he clerk of this court by June 29, 2020.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.  No further time extensions will be granted.
Per order dated April 1, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP2084-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration is denied.  WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21(2).
Per Decision dated March 11, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP2084-CR, By the Court.---Judgment and order affirmed.  This opinion will not be published.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.23(1)(b)5.

records.addlTxt: Count one and two.
Counts three and four.

Defendant Demarco Lee As-Saffat appears by video, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS  consecutive to Count 2 and concurrent with counts 3 and 4, with credit for 465 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS  consecutive to Count 1 and concurrent with counts 3 and 4, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

As to counts 1 and 2: Conditions of extended supervision:
*Sex Offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Take prescribed medications.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No contact with victim.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1, 2 and 4, with credit for 465 days time served.  
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
AS TO COUNT 4:
The court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1, 2 and 3 with credit for 465 days time served.  
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

As to counts 1 and 2: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.

As to all counts: The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision.  

Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,

- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Demarco Lee As-Saffat in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant uncooperative with the PSI investigation.  Defendant states the totality of the PSI report is inaccurate.  Court questions defendant as to the inaccuracies.  Defendant unruly.  Court adminishes defendant as to his behavior.  Court advises defendant that due to his unruly and disruptive behavior, next appearance will be conducted via closed circuit.  Arrangments made.  Case adjourned to 12-22-14 @ 1:30 p.m. for Sentencing in Br. 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Juror brought into court regarding question.  Defendant's motion for mistrial denied by the court.  Juror struck for cause.  Jury in the box at 10:01 a.m.  Defendant has questions regarding recorded statement.  Jury out of the box at 10:05 a.m.  Defendant's question regarding recorded statement addressed by the court.  Jury in the box at 10:08 a.m.  Recorded statement played for the jury.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Danilo Cardenas.  Exhibits 19, 20, 21,22, 23, 24 and 33 offered and received into evidence.  Video shown to the jury.  State rests.  Jury out of the box at 11:41 a.m.  Defendant examined as to his right to remain silent.  Court finds defendant freely voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to remain silent.  Filed, signed Waiver of Right to Remain Silent.  Court breaks for lunch. 
Defendant's motion to amend caption to reflect defendant's name as DeMarco As-Saffat aka DeMarco Williams not objected to by the State and granted by the court.  Jury in the box at 1:28 p.m.  Sworn for the State: DeMarco As-Saffat. Exhibits 54 and 55 offered and received into evidence. Jury out of the box at 3:02 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury instructions and verdicts finalized.  Jury in the box at 3:31 p.m.  Defendant rests.  Sworn as rebuttal for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Danilo Cardenas.  State rests. Testimony closed.  Court instructs the jury.  Closing arguments made by counsel.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors chosen by lot and discharged.  Jury retired to deliberate at the hour of 4:50 p.m. Jury in the box at 4:54 p.m.  Court instructs jury they are not allowed to talk about this case to anyone.  Jury out of the box at 4:55 p.m.  Exhibits 7 and 8 offered and received into evidence. Case adjourned to 6-27-2014 at 9:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in the box at 9:45 a.m.  Sworn for the State: Alison Lopez.  Exhibits 11, 17, 18 and 53 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Patricia Dobrowski.  Exhibits 31, 32, 34, 35 and 30 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 12:01 p.m.  Court breaks for lunch. Jury in the box at 1:26 p.m.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Steven Voss and Passionate M.  Exhibit 46 offered and received.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Meilicke and Milwaukee Police Detective Geri Lindunn.  Exhibits 12, 13, 14, 15 and 16 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 3:10 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 3:39 p.m.  Milwaukee Police Detective Lindunn remains on the stand. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Sargeant Dale Anders and Milwaukee Police Detective Rodney Gonzales.  Exhibit 28 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 4:50 p.m.
Case adjourned to 6-26-2014 at 9:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant's motions that Attorney Harris withdraw and to proceed pro se.  Defendant examined as to his right to counsel.  Court finds defendant is not competent to proceed without counsel and denies defendant's motion to proceed pro se.  Jury in the box at 3:12 p.m.  Azaria remains on the stand. Exhibits 36, 37, 38, 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44 and 45 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 4:21 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 4:37 p.m.  Azaria M. remains on the stand.  Jury out of the box at 4:49 p.m.  Case adjourned to 6-25-2014 at 9:15 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State's motion to amend address in Information not objected to by Attorney Harris, objected to by defendant and granted by the court.  State's motion to introduce defendant's statements argued by counsel and denied by the court.  State's motion to use video during opening statement argued by counsel and denied by the court.  
Jury in the box at 9:54 a.m.  Jury sworn.  Court gives preliminary instructions to the jury.  Opening statements made by Attorneys Josh Mathy and Thomas Harris.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Sargeant Rick Burmeister.  Exhibits 1 and 2 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Sargeant Daniel Wesolowski, Milwaukee Police Officer Monigole and Azaria M.  Exhibit 9 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 11:51 a.m.  Court breaks for lunch.

Jury panel in the box.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:00 p.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:04 p.m.  Strikes for cause put on the record.  Jury in the box at 4:18 p.m.  Parties thereupon proceeded to impanel a jury.  Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled case and who were duly impaneled.  Jury list, in writing, received and filed.  Jury out of the box at 4:48 p.m. Case adjourned to 6-24-2014 at 9:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant initially refused to come into court.  Defendant's motion to have venue change to Federal court denied by the court.  Defendant states Attorney Harris is not his attorney but finds defendant is not asking to represent himself.  Attorney Harris' request for a competency examination argued by counsel.  Defendant refuses to answer the court's questions regarding mental health issues or medications.  Court breaks for lunch.

Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in court with attorney Thomas E. Harris.  Defendant Demarco Lee Williams in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Geri Lin Dunn/MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
